title: @Kateykhaos
body:
Previously when you've been asked by people about what may be the possible reasons of skin delays, you've cited "event timing" as one such reason. Skins are sometimes held back to be released in tandem with other skins (Pool Party, Project, etc.)

Now that Riot has said that they're going to release skins and events without adhering to the timing of their real-world counterparts (I agree with this decision, by the way) does this mean that skins will continue to be delayed for long periods of time to be released in tandem?

replies.body: We've stated that we've got some stuff planned for Snowdown. In a case like that, yes, skins would be held for that event. There will still be instances where you won't see a champion skin for a bit due to them being a part of an event/group of skins that will be released.
Ah okay. It's still good though, because now there's only one barrier (other skins being completed) rather than two (other skins being completed and requiring a certain time of the year)
